subject: p13078497
History: -year-old male with bilateral pulmonary infiltrates, status post CABG.
Findings: Right-sided pleural effusion is again seen largely unchanged. There is left-sided ground glass opacity which has slightly improved consistent with improving pulmonary edema. Endotracheal tube is seen in appropriate position, 6 cm from the carina. NG tube is seen entering the stomach and out of field of view. Incidental note of right lateral pleural calcification which is better seen on CT imaging.
Impression: Improving pulmonary edema with unchanged bilateral pleural effusions.
